result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek M. Berger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any other probation now serving.

miscConds.notes:
If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent. 

Maintain absolute sobriety.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent. 

Maintain absolute sobriety.

You must submit to and successfully complete a mental health evaluation to determine appropriate programming commensurate with needs identified.  Must comply with all recommendations.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. 

140 days jail credit, if revoked.

You shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, or by any other means with JB without permission of JB and Agent. If family conditions change, Agent my give modifications of contact.
Restitution ordered with the dollar amount to be determined at a later date.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Must pay all costs of supervision and court ordered financial obligations during the term of probation. 

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

timeConds.notes: Jail is imposed and stayed on the condition defendant complies with all probation terms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derek M. Berger

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Derek M. Berger
Current: 120 South Center Street, Fairchild, WI 54741 United States  (Effective: 10-26-2022)
Prior: W12445 E Lange Rd, Fairchild, WI 54741
Blank DNA submission order

2:05 PM . Defendant Derek M. Berger in court.  Attorney Bryant S Plank in court for Derek M. Berger.  Attorney Crystal Leigh Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin. State in compliance with victim rights. Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 2. Counts 1 & 3 DRI.  Prior convictions agreed to. 
Court reviewed the elements and potential penalties of the charge the defendant plead to.  He understood.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Felony warnings given.  He understood. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm contrary to 940.19(2), 939.62(1)(b) repeater. Defendant did not exercise his right to allocution. 

Joint recommendation: Withhold sentence and place on 2 years' probation with conditions of AODA & MH evaluations and follow up treatment, maintain absolute sobriety, pay restitution of $26,908.56 to victim, 3 months conditional jail, imposed and stayed. No contact with JB without permission of JB and agent. 141 days credit, if revoked. 

Court largely adopts the joint recommendation: Withholds sentence, orders 3 years probation, 3 months jail imposed and stayed as a condition of probation.  AODA, Mental health evaluations and follow up treatment, maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with JB without permission of JB and agent. If conditions change with family, Agent is given authority to make modification of contact or request a hearing. Ordered court costs to be paid through probation. 140 days jail credit, if revoked. 
Restitution ordered with the dollar amount to be determined within 60 days. 

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

Motion hearing on October 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on October 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on November 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:57 AM Defendant Derek M. Berger not in court, not required to appear for today's hearing. Attorney Bryant S Plank appeared by video for Derek M. Berger.  Attorney Crystal Leigh Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Plank state requests regarding time limits. Proposing a bond modification. State responds, objects to defenses proposal. Asks matter remain on jury calendar. Court's concern: limited dates available. Length of trial in question. Court proposes different dates. Doesn't work, Trial remains on the dates scheduled.
Scheduling conference on September 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Scheduling conference on September 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.
**DISREGARD: Hearing has been rescheduled to 9/19/2022 at 11:00 a.m.**
Telephone scheduling conference on September 12, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Waive reading of the information.  Defense entered NGP.  Court entered NGP on the defendant's behalf.

Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to have a preliminary hearing.

3:50 PM Defendant Derek M. Berger appeared by video, in custody of JCJ.  Attorney Carly Sebion appears specially for Attorney Bryant S Plank appeared by video for Derek M. Berger.  Attorney Jeri Marsolek in court for State of Wisconsin.  Requesting a speedy trial.  Contact JA to schedule.

Status conference on August 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: Victim 1
Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located. 
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.
Not posses any weapons.
